text: Jonathan Seth Shurberg (March 27, 1963 â€“ July 18, 2017) was an American attorney and community advocate of Jewish descent. He was the 2014 Democratic Party candidate for state delegate. He was a practicing lawyer for over twenty years, and was active in Maryland politics from 2002 until his death. Over the course of his political career, Shurberg fought for the voting rights of minorities and young people, the civil rights of LGBT individuals, and for pro-choice causes. Shurberg served on the board of Planned Parenthood of Metropolitan Washington, D.C Action Fund, and his 2014 campaign for delegate was endorsed by NARAL Maryland Pro-Choice PAC and Planned Parenthood of Metropolitan Washington, D.C. Action Fund, as well as The Gazette. Shurberg died on July 18, 2017 in Silver Spring, Maryland from a long-illness at the age of 54.Jonathan Shurberg, activist, attorney, political guru, dies at 54 ==References== ==Other websites== *Campaign website Category:1963 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Lawyers from Philadelphia Category:American political activists Category:Jewish activists Category:Jewish American politicians Category:Jewish lawyers Category:Politicians from Maryland Category:Politicians from Philadelphia Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from Maryland
title: Jonathan Shurberg
